meanings.sent1: The corrosive chemicals slowly ate away at the metal pipes.
meanings.sent2: The strong acid had a corrosive effect on the metal surface.
meanings.sent3: The corrosive liquid turned the rusty old car into a shiny sculpture.
meanings.sent4: His harsh words had a corrosive impact on their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The corrosive nature of time gradually wears down even the strongest structures.

meanings.definition: Tending to destroy or eat away gradually.
meanings.sent1: The corrosive substance left a trail of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent2: The corrosive nature of gossip can harm relationships.
meanings.sent3: The corrosive power of laziness slowly eroded his productivity.
meanings.sent4: The corrosive influence of negativity can eat away at one's happiness.
meanings.sent5: The corrosive impact of pollution on the environment is evident in the dying trees.

meanings.definition: Harmful or destructive in a gradual or subtle way.
meanings.sent1: The corrosive behavior of the bully had a negative impact on the students.
meanings.sent2: The corrosive effects of stress can harm both physical and mental health.
meanings.sent3: His corrosive comments subtly undermined her confidence over time.
meanings.sent4: The corrosive nature of jealousy can slowly poison relationships.
meanings.sent5: The corrosive influence of doubt can eat away at one's self-esteem.
